name: Michael Gecawicz

education.description: Through my studies at the University of Maine, I have created numerous projects in the fields of Video Production, Physical Computing, Mobile Application Development, and more.
During my study abroad semester in Barcelona, I attended courses in Advanced Principles of Design, Packaging Design and participated in group projects with students from around the world.

experience.description: Developed / Managed multiple backend and frontend services for the puspose of targeted advertising for live and streamed TV.
Developed an iOS application for managing social media accounts. Managed a web / native app development team.

publications.name: Bridge Network
publications.details: React Native based socail media application

experience.description: Created protypes for research-based production of sensory-technology. Designed and programmed application specific micro controllers. 3D CAD Design and SLA 3D Printing Management

publications.name: Methods and Systems for Augmenting and/or Stimulating Flavor - Co-Creator
publications.description: A Device for Simulating the Flavors of Food and Drink

publications.name: Influence of Electric Taste, Smell, Color, and Thermal Sensory Modalities on the Liking and Mediated Emotions of Virtual Flavor Perceptio - Co-Author
publications.details: Published – ICMI '20: Proceedings of the 2020 International Conference on Multimodal Interaction – Pages 296-304

experience.position: Project Manager / UX Designer / Software Developer
experience.description: Led multiple projects, both research and client based. Developed mobile applications, VR technology, physical computing, video production, and climate simulation.

publications.name: Friend Finder
publications.details: A project aimed to be a physical social media, to connect people face to face. Designed for very large scale and flexible situations.

publications.name: iSWOOP
publications.details: Phase II of the National Science Foundation (Advancing Informal STEM Learning of the Division of Research on Learning) funded project iSWOOP

publications.name: Here4Quee
publications.details: iOS app aimed to help members of the LGBTQ+ community connect with each other to talk through difficult situations
